RECORD.TEXT: 380123126 PUMC 5101865 459068 694626 03/04/2001 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : CHIRD , CARA UNIT NUMBER : 973-02-94 ADMISSION DATE : 03/04/2001 DISCHARGE DATE : 03/07/2001 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : L3-4 lateral disc herniation . SPECIAL PROCEDURES AND OPERATIONS : Left L3-4 disc excision on March 4 , 2001 . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS / REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient is a 42 year old female who was admitted with chief complaint of low back pain and left anterior thigh pain and hypesthesia . She presented with increasing low back pain for two months which suddenly became severe on February 7 , 2001 . The patient was admitted at that time because she was unable to manage at home . She had no bowel or bladder incontinence , no fever , no constitutional symptoms . Magnetic resonance imaging scan showed L3-4 left lateral disc herniation in the foramen . Two selective nerve root blocks at L3 on the left did not give her relief . The patient was on Oxycontin 60 mg per day , Percocet 6 to 8 tabs a day and Motrin without adequate relief . Therefore , surgical procedure was undertaken . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : The past medical history was remarkable for depression and anxiety . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Nil . ALLERGIES : The patient is allergic to sulfa . MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : Prozac 20 mg q-day , Trazodone 75 mg qhs , Clorazepate 7.5 mg PO q-day , Motrin 600 mg PO t.i.d. , Oxycontin 40 mg qhs , 20 mg each morning , Percocet 1-2 tablets PO q4-6h prn pain , Flexeril 10 mg qhs , Ativan 0.5 to 1 mg q4h prn , Milk of Magnesia , Dulcolax , Colace , Zantac 150 mg PO b.i.d. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On physical examination , she was fit and uncomfortable . Blood pressure 130/80 . Head , eyes , ears , nose and throat examination was within normal limits . Neck was supple . Chest was clear to auscultation and percussion . Cardiovascular examination : regular rate and rhythm without murmurs , rubs or gallops . The abdomen was benign . Extremities : dorsalis pedis pulses were 2+ and symmetrical bilaterally . She had decreased sensation on left anterior thigh and a 4+ to 5-/5 left quadriceps . HOSPITAL COURSE AND TREATMENT : The patient was admitted through the Same Day Surgical Unit on 03-04-01 and underwent a left lateral disc excision which was uncomplicated . Postoperatively , she had good relief of her anterior thigh pain but considerable back pain . She underwent physical therapy and pain management . She continued to have hypesthesia on the anterior thigh . On March 7 , her wound was clean , her motor strength was intact on the right and she was discharged . FOLLOW UP : The patient is to follow up in six weeks with Dr. Strength . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Same as on admission .
